attributes.action: Allow learner drivers to continue to practise in their own car through lockdown
attributes.additional_details: Allow learner drivers to continue to practise in their own car with a member of their household or support bubble in lockdown to allow people to pass their tests sooner and avoid a backlog of people re-booking tests for later dates as they won’t be ready for tests just after lockdown.
attributes.background: On the gov.uk website, it now states that learner drivers cannot practise to drive in their own car accompanied by a member of their household or support bubble during this lockdown yet it is still allowed in Scotland and Wales. How is this fair?

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/559063

Under current Government guidance, you can practise driving with members of your household or support bubble. It must be travel for work, education or other essential journeys: https://www.gov.uk/driving-lessons-learning-to-drive/practising-with-family-or-friends

Under current Government guidance, you can practise driving with members of your household or support bubble. It must be travel for work, education or other essential journeys: https://www.gov.uk/driving-lessons-learning-to-drive/practising-with-family-or-friends

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign: 

Allow learner drivers to go out and drive with people from their household: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/559063
